duties_responsibilities.duty: Formulate the company's future direction through providing input on the company's business plan, financial and tax strategies, budgeting, and forecasting.
Develop forward-looking proforma financials (P&L, Balance Sheet, and Statement of Cash Flows).
Develop, track, and report performance metrics for all departments and the company.
Build and maintain strong relationships with management team members, shareholders, and 3rd parties.
Manage the accounting, investor relations, legal, tax, and treasury departments.
Oversee the financial operations of subsidiary companies and international operations.
Manage any third parties to which accounting or finance functions have been outsourced.
Oversee the company's transaction processing system.
Negotiate cost-effective employee benefit plans, workman's comp insurance, product liability insurance, and other insurance as needed.
Provide financial analysis and oversight for large transactions including acquisitions, large purchases, distribution agreements contracts, and supplier agreements.
Personally review and approve all Form 8-K, 10-K, and 10-Q filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (if the company is publicly held).
Understand and mitigate key elements of the company's risk profile.
Monitor all open legal issues involving the company, and legal issues affecting the industry; ensure that the company complies with all legal and regulatory requirements.

education_certification.credential: CPA certification with at least 8-10 years of experience
